statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Milton Doyle scored 21 points, had six assists and three rebounds to lift Loyola-Chicago past Alcorn State 69-44 on Friday night.
article.headline: Loyola(Chi) uses spurt after half to beat Alcorn State 69-44
article.linkText: Loyola(Chi) uses spurt after half to beat Alcorn State 69-44
article.story: CHICAGO -- Milton Doyle scored 21 points, had six assists and three rebounds to lift Loyola-Chicago past Alcorn State 69-44 on Friday night. The win gives the Ramblers their fifth consecutive season-opening win. Loyola used a 17-0 run early in the second half to take control of the game. The Ramblers struggled from the field and foul line in the first half, shooting 1-for-10 from beyond the 3-point arc and 6-for-14 from the free throw line. Reginal Johnson gave the Braves a 35-33 lead on a layup with 14:19 remaining to play, before Clayton Custer's 3 ignited the second half run. Custer-who scored 10 points-made another 3 to put Loyola on top 50-35. The Braves got no closer than 13 the rest of the way. Marquis Vance, the Braves' leading scorer, had all 12 of his points in the first half and 10 of his 11 rebounds before the break.
